sentences: Luis Ferdinand Vega Jr. (born June 12, 1965), better known as "Little Louie" Vega, is an American DJ, record producer and Grammy Award winner remixer of Puerto Rican ancestry.

By 1985, Louie began playing house and block parties in his local Bronx and his first nightclub residency was at the Devil's Nest, in the Bronx, and later he moved to heartthrob (the old Funhouse), Roseland, Studio 54 and the Palladium in Manhattan.

During the 1990s, Vega was playing at one of the most influential nightclubs for house music, The Sound Factory Bar at the Underground Network Parties with promoters Don Welch and Barbara Tucker (also singer).
Vega is also the cousin of Eric Vega, a popular event creator and promoter in New York City.
Louie Vega is presently married to vocalist Ana Martins, also known as Anané Vega.
Louie Vega was ranked #5 at the Top House Artists of 2020 by Traxsource.
Louie Vega was ranked #1 at the Top Artists of 2021 by Traxsource.
